name: impregnably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is strongly built and cannot be entered by force: The castle at Salzburg is impregnably and romantically situated on top of the hill. The computer system is impregnably firewalled.
in a way that is powerful and impossible to beat: Most of the state seems impregnably Republican. Both men are impregnably established in academic positions.
More examplesFewer examplesThe row of houses stood locked, barred, and bolted impregnably.She represents an impregnably safe Labour seat in Manchester.
